questions.text: Match the DHCP message types with their corresponding scenarios in a typical DHCP client-server interaction.
right: Client broadcasts to find available DHCP servers
Server responds with an IP lease offer
Client requests the offered IP address
Server confirms the IP lease allocation

questions.text: Consider the following statements regarding the TCP/IP protocol stack: 1. The Internet Protocol (IP) operates at the Network Layer and is responsible for host-to-host addressing and routing. 2. Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) ensures reliable data delivery at the Transport Layer through flow control and error checking. 3. The Application Layer protocols such as HTTP and FTP are directly responsible for routing packets across networks. Which of the above statements is/are correct?
In Distance Vector Routing, what is the primary method used for route updates?
options: A. Broadcasting routing tables to all neighbors
B. Periodically exchanging routing tables with all neighbors
C. Using a hierarchical routing scheme
D. Employing link-state advertisements to update neighbors
